availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Administrative body of the state of Virginia. Capital at Richmond (1780-1861, 1865-Present), Wheeling (1861-1863), and Alexandria (1863-1865). On April 17, 1861, representatives at the Virginia State Convention of 1861 voted to secede from the United States and join the Confederacy. Pro-Union Virginians voted at the Wheeling Convention on June 11, 1861 to create the “Restored Government of Virginia.” Governor(s): John Letcher (January 1, 1860-June 20, 1861), Francis Harrison Pierpont (June 20, 1861- April 4, 1868).
